Articles.Content:
I've been using AIES legs in the past, they're pretty cool looking, but they have an animation problem in the model and started throwing NREs in 0.90, so i'm looking for a replacement.

![bnE042B.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bnE042B.jpg)

I'm having a real hard time with not just replying "*your mom have some*".

Joke aside, I like the landing legs from the Near Future mod. They are a bit short (they don't extend far out or down) but they are sturdy and nice looking (aerodynamic too).

I once used the legs from the KW pack (or something that sounded like that) but I haven't touched any part-heavy mod packs in about two years.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-19T09:44:08Z" title="02/19/2015 09:44  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 19, 2015</time> by Axelord FTW**
  
typo
I like the legs that come with Karbonite. ItÃ‚Â´s one part with four legs and its usefull and looks good.

I've seen both parts Karbonite and Near Future.

![ciUtuSu.png](http://i.imgur.com/ciUtuSu.png)

Not very good for small probes. Are there any other good parts?

More beautiful legs anyone? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-20T18:19:41Z" title="02/20/2015 06:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 20, 2015</time> by Enceos**

B9 has two very large legs.

The Infernal Robots Model rework has a [landing foot](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65365-WIP-MSI-s-Infernal-Robotics-Model-Rework-%28Updated-27-08-2014%29?p=1705913&viewfull=1#post1705913) (not a leg, a foot!).

[Transparend pods](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/84054) has an ultra tiny landing leg.

Ah yes, forgot to delete the B9 legs to reduce the part count. Never used them anyway. Found some cool legs in the Nova Punch pack!

![fpfNkyr.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fpfNkyr.jpg)
